audio_item.dc.title: Sound Recording - University of Michigan Men's Glee Club & Cornell University Glee Club - 1952 November 07
audio_item.dc.contributor.author: University of Michigan. Men's Glee Club
audio_item.dc.rights.access: This material is available for research only in the Reading Room of the Bentley Historical Library at the University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI).

audio_item.dc.description: Content note: The sound recording(s) associated with this repository item derive from a single audio reel tape. A single tape may yield multiple audio files if there were variations in tape stock, speed, or channels (i.e. stereo or mono). For more information see http://deepblue.lib.umich.edu/handle/2027.42/108126.
audio_item.dc.abstract: [Program 6] : [Side 1] : [Part 1] : Tape 2 of 3; The Cornell Glee Club and Cayuga's Waiters performs Down in the Valley [text illegible]; Russian Picnic (arr. Harvey Enders); Early One Morning (arr. Gwynn Bement); Old Mother Hubbard (Victor Hely-Hutchinson). The University of Michigan Men's Glee Club performs Laudes Atque Carmina (Traditional Opening Hymn, A. A. Stanley); Music Will Calm Thee (From Rodelinda, Soloist-Robert Elson - Baritone, Handel); Hallelujah, Amen (from Judas Maccabeus, Handel).
